concept.title: Before Storage

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Checklist and steps to prepare CD-series trucks for storage, including fluid handling, protection, battery care and periodic checks.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: prepare and preserve vehicle for safe storage and return-to-service readiness

conbody.p: Before storing your lift truck, clean and inspect as per the following procedures.

ul.li: Wipe away grease, oil, etc. adhering to the body of the truck with waste cloth, and use water, if needed.
While cleaning the truck, check general condition of the truck. Especially check the truck body for dents or damage and tyres for wear or nails or stones in the tread.
Fill the fuel tank with fuel specified.
Check for leakage of hydraulic oil, engine oil, fuel, or coolant, etc.
Check for looseness of nuts and bolts, especially hub nuts.
Check mast rollers to see that they rotate smoothly.
Prime the oil into the lift cylinders by actuating the lift lever all the way several times.
Drain off coolant completely in cold weather, if antifreeze is not used.
Drain off DEF/Ad-Blue completely for long term storage. (If not the purity of DEF/Ad-Blue would be changed to lower quality.)
